intro: Linaria meonantha, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Linaria meonantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
